item.title: Report X-2024090245
item.description:
Report X-2024090245

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-04
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Aaron Rico Supervisor called safety to report a spill in trailer 551331, UN1090, ACETONE, 3, PG II. Aaron stated it looked to be a 1-gallon Pail leaked approximately 10oz of the product in the box it is packaged in and has saturated the box. Aaron stated the pail was damaged while in transit due to not be braced or blocked correctly and fell off the pallet and fell to the floor. Aaron stated the crew found the spill while unloading trailer 551331 and stopped work to report the spill. Aaron stated the spill looks to be contained to the box it is packaged in and is still in the trailer but may h ave spilled on the trailer floor as well.~~~

item.title: Report E-2024090059
item.description:
Report E-2024090059

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to improper dunnage, approximately 5 lbs. of Sodium Metasilicate Pentahydrate (hazardous - UN3253) was released. The terminal requested a contractor to assist with cleanup and containment due to the hazardous and corrosive state of the product. The contractor arrived on-site and confirmed approximately 5-pounds of product was released affecting an 1’x1’ area of the trailer floor. The contractor collected and containerized the Sodium Metasilicate Pentahydrate and all clean-up debris into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090057
item.description:
Report E-2024090057

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-29
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XHG contacted ERTS to report a spill. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with cleanup. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the packaging and shrink-wrap and estimated that twelve (12) ounces of material were released due to loose caps. First Call Environmental personnel moved all the boxes from the pallet to verify the damage. The bottles with bad seals were placed into six (6) 55-gallon poly drums and the impacted absorbents and cardboard were placed into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization
